com.bachelor_project.reactive

Class Scheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bachelor_project.reactive.Scheduler

  • public class Scheduler
extends Object
    Handles the lock requests for shared variables as well as the transition from one instant to the next. Keeps a list of lock requests and a counter for the number of active threads. When the counter reaches 0, if there are any lock requests in the list, the locks are granted to threads in the order of their priority. If the list of requests is empty, all threads are notified no proceed to the next instance.
    Author:
    Alexandru Babeanu

    • Method Detail

      • registerThread

        public void registerThread(long id,
                           long parentId,
                           SignalGuard guard)
        Registers a thread as part of the interpreted program. Add the relevant information in a list, at a position that reflects the priority of the new thread. Called at the beginning of ThreadedStatement.execute(com.bachelor_project.reactive.SignalGuard, java.util.Map)
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the thread being registered
        parentId - the id of the thread that spawned the registered thread
        guard - the SignalGuard object that manages the registered thread
        See Also:
        SignalGuard, Thread.getId(), ThreadedStatement.execute(com.bachelor_project.reactive.SignalGuard, java.util.Map)

      • deregisterThread

        public void deregisterThread()
        Stop managing a thread. Called when ThreadedStatement.run() finishes execution.
        See Also:
        }

      • incrementActiveThreadCount

        public void incrementActiveThreadCount()
        Increment the number of active threads. Used by a thread when waking up another.

      • decrementActiveThreadCount

        public void decrementActiveThreadCount()
        Decrement the number of active threads. Used by a thread before entering a waiting state.

      • nextInstant

        public void nextInstant(Runnable endInstantHandler)
        Waits until all threads in the program reach a suspended/terminated state, then either distributes resources, if any are requested, or executes the provided Runnable to perform the transition from one instant to the next.
        Parameters:
        endInstantHandler - the Runnable to execute at the end of an instant
        See Also:
        Runnable.run()

      • declareResources

        public void declareResources(List<LockedPointer> resources)
        Used to register shared variables that need to be managed by the scheduler.
        Parameters:
        resources - the list of LockedPointer objects that encode the new shared variables
        See Also:
        LockedPointer

      • requestResources

        public void requestResources(List<LockedPointer> resources)
                      throws RuntimeException
        Used by a thread to register its requests for shared variables.
        Parameters:
        resources - the list of LockedPointer objects that encode the requested shared variables
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - when a thread requests a resource that was not registered with the scheduler
        See Also:
        LockedPointer

      • releaseResources

        public void releaseResources(List<LockedPointer> resources)
        Used by a thread to release resource locks.
        Parameters:
        resources - the list of LockedPointer objects that encode the released shared variables
        See Also:
        LockedPointer
